creator: tal@csfi.com
text:
The deployer takes the WAR and extract it for the first time. Then when I drop a
new WAR file (replce the exist WAR) it is not replacing the previous one. This
is happenning regardless of whether there is a session or not. The <Host ..>
does not contain the autoDeploy="true", but when I go the the Manager it is set
to True. If I place the autoDeply="true" and then open Manager, it removes that
valiable from the servers.xml!

Here is the example:

drwxr-xr-x   8 root root    4096 Mar 15 14:57 WebReport
-rwxrwxrwx   1 swx  root 2880043 Mar 15 15:02 WebReport.war

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
You have to explicitly update the deployment via the Manager app.  Grep
http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/manager-howto.html for "update" to see
the syntax.  (Using this syntax, redeployment works without a hitch for me,
whether using packed or unpacked WARs, and with or without initial autoDeploy)

So the auto redeployment from 5.0 is gone on 5.5? I would have to explicitly
redeploy the application each time? If so, is there any effect to the autoDeploy
variable?!
creator: tal@csfi.com

text:
It's not entirely gone, but its semantics and behavior have changed from 5.0. 
See the updated 5.5 docs especially in the Host configuration page.
